details.description: It has striking grey-green coloured, fleshy spoon-shaped leaves growing in a rosette on a stem. It is a popular groundcover plant in rockeries and water-wise gardens.
The Bunny Ears cactus has fine hair-like spines (glochids) that are extremely thin. The white or yellow glochids give the plant a dotted appearance like polka dots.

details.dimensions: 20” (50 cm) in diameter and 10” (25 cm) tall
details.description: One of the delightful features of this desert cactus is the reddish-purple flowers that can sometimes appear.

details.dimensions: 6” (15 cm) tall and measure 18” (45 cm)
details.description: The stunning large globe-shaped Balloon cactus has a large rib-like appearance with rows of contrasting white or yellow spines on the edge.

details.dimensions: 6” to 12” (15 – 30 cm) long and up to 24” (60 cm)
details.description: A very popular indoor type of cactus is the Christmas cactus that is native to tropical regions in Brazil.

details.dimensions: 3” and 5” (7.5 – 12 cm) high
details.description: Mammillaria boolii is a small round cactus covered in fine hair-like spines. The interesting feature of this cactus is the relatively large flowers which appear on this small cactus.
Originating in Paraguay and Argentina, the Moon cactus is an unusual type of cactus with a colorful top that can be red, pink, orange or yellow.

details.dimensions: small as 1.5” (4 cm) with the largest types growing up to 6” (15 cm) in diameter.
details.description: The botanical name for the chin cactus variety (Gymnocalycium) comes from the fact that it’s “hairless” or “spineless” cactus.

details.dimensions: small as 1.5” (4 cm) with the largest types growing up to 6” (15 cm) in diameter.
details.description: The Star cactus is a green cactus with a smooth round, bulging shape, covered in white dots, fine hairs, and a line of raised tufts along the center of each segment.

details.dimensions: grow up to 6 ft. (1.8 m) tall.
details.description: The Fairy Castle cactus is identified by its long green spiky stems, small side growths on the stems, and whitish flowers that may turn pale orange when blooming.

details.dimensions: grow 2.3” to 6” (6 – 15 cm) long and up to 1.6” (4 cm) in diameter.
details.description: The Lady Finger cactus is a small cactus plant with stubby columnar stems covered in sharp fuzzy spikes.
